questionnaire.name: 7. theBIKEnet Beliefs and Attitudes - Cycling, Wellbeing and Micromobility

sections.title: theBIKEnet Beliefs and Attitudes Questionnaire
sections.description:
üö≤ theBIKEnet is a public research project that explores how people cycle and move through cities - combining science, technology, and everyday experience. Our goal is to make urban mobility safer, fairer, and more sustainable for everyone.

This seventh questionnaire focuses on your beliefs, attitudes, and feelings about micromobility (bicycles and e-scooters). It looks at motivations, barriers, social influences, and wellbeing that shape everyday mobility choices. Understanding these aspects helps us explore how cultural, emotional, and personal factors influence sustainable mobility behaviour.

Participation is completely voluntary and anonymous. The information you provide will be used only for scientific and educational purposes.

Learn more about theBIKEnet project

sections.title: Perceived Advantages and Disadvantages
sections.description: People adopt or avoid cycling and using e-scooters for different reasons. This section explores both the perceived benefits and the perceived inconveniences of these modes.

questions.text: In your opinion, what are the main advantages of using bicycles or e-scooters?

options.text: Convenient for short trips (e.g., under 5 km)
Can be combined with public transport for longer journeys
Reduces air pollution and environmental impact
Access to narrow streets and local destinations
Pleasure of outdoor activity or open air

questions.text: What do you consider to be the main disadvantages or discomforts of using bicycles or e-scooters?

options.text: Carrying items or passengers is inconvenient
Lack of changing or shower facilities
Need to plan routes or charging for e-scooters

questions.text: Which of these advantages do you consider the most important for you personally?

sections.title: Social and Cultural Factors
sections.description: Social norms and cultural context can influence who feels encouraged or discouraged to use micromobility. This section explores perceived accessibility and representation among different groups.

questions.text: Do you think there are any cultural or social barriers that limit who uses bicycles or e-scooters?
If yes, which groups do you believe are more affected?

options.text: People with demanding or high-status jobs
People from ethnic or cultural minority groups
No, I don‚Äôt think there are significant barriers

questions.text: To what extent do you think social or cultural barriers discourage people from cycling or riding an e-scooter in your city?

sections.title: Perceived Risks and Practical Challenges
sections.description: This section explores perceived barriers or difficulties that might discourage the use of bicycles or e-scooters in daily mobility.

questions.text: Which of the following issues make you feel less inclined to use a bicycle or e-scooter (in the past 3 months)?

options.text: Lack of nearby repair or rental points

questions.text: What challenges do you experience when combining bicycles or e-scooters with public transport?

options.text: Lack of intermodal facilities (bike racks, parking, etc.)
Restrictions or unclear rules for carrying bicycles
I do not face any challenges
I do not have experience combining bicycles/e-scooters with public transport

questions.text: Overall, how much do these issues discourage you from using a bicycle or e-scooter?
How easy do you find it to integrate micromobility (e.g., cycling, e-scooter) into your daily routine?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use micromobility)

sections.title: Cycling Wellbeing and Feelings
sections.description: How cycling makes you feel and how your sense of safety and caution has changed over time.

questions.text: How much do you think cycling affects your overall wellbeing?

options.text: It does not affect my wellbeing

questions.text: When cycling, how free and active do you feel?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not currently cycle)

questions.text: When cycling, how calm and focused do you feel?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not currently cycle)

questions.text: Over the past 5 years, how has your sense of safety while cycling changed?

options.text: Not applicable (I have been cycling for less than 5 years)

questions.text: Over the past 5 years, how has your caution when cycling changed?

options.text: Not applicable (I have been cycling for less than 5 years)

This seventh questionnaire focuses on your beliefs, attitudes, and feelings about micromobility (bicycles and e-scooters). It looks at motivations, barriers, social influences, and wellbeing that shape everyday mobility choices. Understanding these aspects helps us explore how cultural, emotional, and personal factors influence sustainable mobility behaviour.

Participation is completely voluntary and anonymous. The information you provide will be used only for scientific and educational purposes.

Learn more about theBIKEnet project

it.#7. theBIKEnet Beliefs and Attitudes - C: 7. Opinioni e atteggiamenti theBIKEnet ‚Äì Bici, benessere e micromobilit√†
it.#theBIKEnet Beliefs and Attitudes Questi: Questionario theBIKEnet su opinioni e atteggiamenti
it.#üö≤ <b>theBIKEnet</b> is a public rese:
üö≤ theBIKEnet √® un progetto di ricerca pubblico che esplora come le persone vanno in bicicletta e si muovono nelle citt√†, combinando scienza, tecnologia ed esperienza quotidiana. Il nostro obiettivo √® rendere la mobilit√† urbana pi√π sicura, pi√π equa e pi√π sostenibile per tutte le persone.

Questo settimo questionario riguarda le tue opinioni, i tuoi atteggiamenti e le tue sensazioni sulla micromobilit√† (biciclette e monopattini elettrici). Esplora motivazioni, barriere, influenze sociali e benessere che incidono sulle scelte di mobilit√† quotidiana. Comprendere questi aspetti ci aiuta a capire come fattori culturali, emotivi e personali influenzano i comportamenti di mobilit√† sostenibile.

La partecipazione √® completamente volontaria e anonima. Le informazioni che fornisci saranno utilizzate solo per scopi scientifici e didattici.

Scopri di pi√π sul progetto theBIKEnet
it.#People adopt or avoid cycling and using: Le persone scelgono o evitano la bicicletta e l‚Äôuso del monopattino elettrico per motivi diversi. Questa sezione esplora sia i benefici percepiti sia gli aspetti che possono risultare scomodi o svantaggiosi.
it.#In your opinion, what are the main adva: Secondo te, quali sono i principali vantaggi di andare in bicicletta o usare un monopattino elettrico?
it.#Health and physical fitness benefits: Benefici per la salute e la forma fisica
it.#Convenient for short trips (e.g., under: Comodo per spostamenti brevi (es. sotto i 5 km)
it.#Can be combined with public transport f: Si pu√≤ combinare con il trasporto pubblico per spostamenti pi√π lunghi
it.#Reduces air pollution and environmental: Riduce l‚Äôinquinamento dell‚Äôaria e l‚Äôimpatto ambientale
it.#Convenient in congested traffic areas: Comodo in aree con traffico congestionato
it.#Access to narrow streets and local dest: Accesso a strade strette e destinazioni locali
it.#Pleasure of outdoor activity or open ai: Piacere di stare all‚Äôaria aperta / attivit√† all‚Äôaperto
it.#What do you consider to be the main dis: Quali sono, secondo te, i principali svantaggi o disagi dell‚Äôandare in bicicletta o usare un monopattino elettrico?
it.#Safety risks in traffic: Rischi per la sicurezza nel traffico
it.#Need to plan routes or charging for e-s: Necessit√† di pianificare i percorsi o la ricarica (per i monopattini elettrici)
it.#Which of these advantages do you consid: Quale di questi vantaggi √® pi√π importante per te personalmente?
it.#Time savings / avoiding congestion: Risparmio di tempo / evitare la congestione
it.#Social norms and cultural context can i: Le norme sociali e il contesto culturale possono influenzare chi si sente incoraggiato o scoraggiato a usare la micromobilit√†. Questa sezione esplora l‚Äôaccessibilit√† percepita e la rappresentazione di diversi gruppi.
it.#Do you think there are any cultural or: Pensi che esistano barriere sociali o culturali che limitano chi usa la bicicletta o il monopattino elettrico?
it.#If yes, which groups do you believe are: Se s√¨, quali gruppi pensi siano pi√π interessati?
it.#People with demanding or high-status jo: Persone con lavori impegnativi o di alto profilo
it.#People from ethnic or cultural minority: Persone appartenenti a minoranze etniche o culturali
it.#No, I don‚Äôt think there are significa: No, non credo ci siano barriere significative
it.#To what extent do you think social or c: In che misura pensi che le barriere sociali o culturali scoraggino le persone dall‚Äôandare in bicicletta o usare un monopattino elettrico nella tua citt√†?
it.#This section explores perceived barrier: Questa sezione esplora barriere o difficolt√† percepite che potrebbero scoraggiare l‚Äôuso della bicicletta o del monopattino elettrico negli spostamenti quotidiani.
it.#Which of the following issues make you: Quali dei seguenti aspetti ti fanno sentire meno propensa/o a usare la bicicletta o il monopattino elettrico (negli ultimi 3 mesi)?
it.#Difficult road or traffic conditions: Condizioni stradali o di traffico difficili
it.#Lack of nearby repair or rental points: Mancanza di punti di riparazione o noleggio nelle vicinanze
it.#What challenges do you experience when: Quali difficolt√† incontri quando combini bicicletta o monopattino elettrico con il trasporto pubblico?
it.#Lack of intermodal facilities (bike rac: Mancanza di servizi intermodali (rastrelliere, parcheggi, ecc.)
it.#Restrictions or unclear rules for carry: Restrizioni o regole poco chiare per portare la bicicletta
it.#Feeling of disturbing other passengers: Sensazione di dare fastidio ad altri passeggeri
it.#I do not have experience combining bicy: Non ho esperienza nel combinare bicicletta/monopattino elettrico con il trasporto pubblico
it.#Overall, how much do these issues disco: In generale, quanto queste difficolt√† ti scoraggiano dall‚Äôusare la bicicletta o il monopattino elettrico?
it.#How easy do you find it to integrate mi: Quanto ti risulta facile integrare la micromobilit√† (es. bicicletta, monopattino elettrico) nella tua routine quotidiana?
it.#How cycling makes you feel and how your: Come ti fa sentire andare in bicicletta e come sono cambiati nel tempo il tuo senso di sicurezza e la tua prudenza.
it.#How much do you think cycling affects y: Quanto pensi che andare in bicicletta influisca sul tuo benessere complessivo?
it.#When cycling, how free and active do yo: Quando vai in bicicletta, quanto ti senti libero/a e attivo/a?
it.#Not applicable (I do not currently cycl: Non applicabile (al momento non vado in bicicletta)
it.#When cycling, how calm and focused do y: Quando vai in bicicletta, quanto ti senti calmo/a e concentrato/a?
it.#Over the past 5 years, how has your sen: Negli ultimi 5 anni, come √® cambiato il tuo senso di sicurezza quando vai in bicicletta?
it.#Not applicable (I have been cycling for: Non applicabile (vado in bicicletta da meno di 5 anni)
it.#Over the past 5 years, how has your cau: Negli ultimi 5 anni, come √® cambiata la tua prudenza quando vai in bicicletta?
